I dual boot between hoary and warty: ok, question if im using acclerated drivers on a 9700 pro what FPS should i get in glxgears
no, linux distros dont like ati
but i get really horrible FPS in AA even with all the textures on super low and at the lowest possible resolution
2200 isn't horrible fps for an ATI card, just stick with XFree86, your card isn't supported yet with Hoary

Glxgears isn't really a benchmarking utility, if you get over 1k fps, then you have hardware acceleration, thats all it was ever really ment to test. And with the ATI card because the driver isn't open source, there isn't much you can do about it, simply said its working above 1kfps, so its working, you can make sure you don't have conflicting modules running, ie no 'ati', you should just have 'fglrx'
make sure 'dri' and 'ati' aren't loaded with lsmod
if you see anything that looks suspecious of being a video module kill it
uhh, aside from fglrx i dont think so
In your xfree86, do you have the module 'fglrx' set under your primary display adapter?
yes i do... thats why i get 2600+ in fglrx

2k fps, really isn't that shabby for a ATI 9600-9800 there windows drivers are sub par, and their linux drivers are even worse than their windows drivers -- sorry thats all i can tell you, i upgraded to hoary and haven't had 3d acceleration since. i wasn't aware of the incompatability between xorg/fglrx, needless to say i don't think there will be a fix, i think ati will eventually make the buisness move to drop linux supp
